com.googlecode.lanterna.terminal.text

Class UnixTerminal

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.lanterna.terminal.AbstractTerminal
      • com.googlecode.lanterna.terminal.InputEnabledAbstractTerminal
        • com.googlecode.lanterna.terminal.text.StreamBasedTerminal
          • com.googlecode.lanterna.terminal.text.ANSITerminal
            • com.googlecode.lanterna.terminal.text.UnixTerminal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InputProvider, Terminal

    public class UnixTerminal
extends ANSITerminal
    A common ANSI terminal extention with support for Unix resize signals and the stty program to control cbreak and key echo
    Author:
    Martin

      This enum lets you control some more low-level behaviors of this terminal object.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void enterPrivateMode()
      Calling this method will, where supported, give your terminal a private area to use, separate from what was there before.
      void exitPrivateMode()
      If you have previously entered private mode, this method will exit this and, depending on implementation, maybe restore what the terminal looked like before private mode was entered.

      Returns the size of the terminal, expressed as a TerminalSize object.

      Enabling cbreak mode will allow you to read user input immediately as the user enters the characters, as opposed to reading the data in lines as the user presses enter.

      Enables or disables keyboard echo, meaning the immediate output of the characters you type on your keyboard.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UnixTerminal

        public UnixTerminal(InputStream terminalInput,
            OutputStream terminalOutput,
            Charset terminalCharset)
        Creates a UnixTerminal using a specified input stream, output stream and character set.
        Parameters:
        terminalInput - Input stream to read terminal input from
        terminalOutput - Output stream to write terminal output to
        terminalCharset - Character set to use when converting characters to bytes

      • UnixTerminal

        public UnixTerminal(InputStream terminalInput,
            OutputStream terminalOutput,
            Charset terminalCharset,
            UnixTerminalSizeQuerier customSizeQuerier)
        Creates a UnixTerminal using a specified input stream, output stream and character set.
        Parameters:
        terminalInput - Input stream to read terminal input from
        terminalOutput - Output stream to write terminal output to
        terminalCharset - Character set to use when converting characters to bytes
        customSizeQuerier - Object to use for looking up the size of the terminal, or null to use the built-in method

      • UnixTerminal

        public UnixTerminal(InputStream terminalInput,
            OutputStream terminalOutput,
            Charset terminalCharset,
            UnixTerminalSizeQuerier customSizeQuerier,
            UnixTerminal.Behaviour terminalBehaviour)
        Creates a UnixTerminal using a specified input stream, output stream and character set.
        Parameters:
        terminalInput - Input stream to read terminal input from
        terminalOutput - Output stream to write terminal output to
        terminalCharset - Character set to use when converting characters to bytes
        customSizeQuerier - Object to use for looking up the size of the terminal, or null to use the built-in method
        terminalBehaviour - Special settings on how the terminal will behave, see UnixTerminalMode for more details

    • Method Detail

      • queryTerminalSize

        @Deprecated
public TerminalSize queryTerminalSize()
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: Terminal
        Will ask the terminal of its current size dimensions, represented by a TerminalSize object. Please note that the default way of figuring this information out is asynchorous and so you will be given the last known dimensions. With proper resize listeners set up, this will only be a problem for figuring out the initial size of the terminal.
        Specified by:
        queryTerminalSize in interface Terminal
        Overrides:
        queryTerminalSize in class ANSITerminal
        Returns:
        a TerminalSize object representing the size of the terminal
        See Also:
        TerminalSize

      • getTerminalSize

        public TerminalSize getTerminalSize()
        Description copied from interface: Terminal
        Returns the size of the terminal, expressed as a TerminalSize object. Please bear in mind that depending on the Terminal implementation, this may or may not be accurate. See the implementing classes for more information.
        Specified by:
        getTerminalSize in interface Terminal
        Overrides:
        getTerminalSize in class ANSITerminal
        Returns:
        Size of the terminal

      • readInput

        public Key readInput()
        Description copied from interface: InputProvider
        Returns the next Key off the input queue or null if there is no more input events available
        Specified by:
        readInput in interface InputProvider
        Overrides:

      • enterPrivateMode

        public void enterPrivateMode()
        Description copied from interface: Terminal
        Calling this method will, where supported, give your terminal a private area to use, separate from what was there before. Some terminal emulators will preserve the terminal history and restore it when you exit private mode.
        Specified by:
        enterPrivateMode in interface Terminal
        Overrides:
        enterPrivateMode in class ANSITerminal

      • exitPrivateMode

        public void exitPrivateMode()
        Description copied from interface: Terminal
        If you have previously entered private mode, this method will exit this and, depending on implementation, maybe restore what the terminal looked like before private mode was entered.
        Specified by:
        exitPrivateMode in interface Terminal
        Overrides:
        exitPrivateMode in class ANSITerminal

      • setCBreak

        public void setCBreak(boolean cbreakOn)
        Description copied from class: ANSITerminal
        Enabling cbreak mode will allow you to read user input immediately as the user enters the characters, as opposed to reading the data in lines as the user presses enter. If you want your program to respond to user input by the keyboard, you probably want to enable cbreak mode.
        Specified by:
        setCBreak in class ANSITerminal
        See Also:
        POSIX terminal interface

      • setEcho

        public void setEcho(boolean echoOn)
        Description copied from class: ANSITerminal
        Enables or disables keyboard echo, meaning the immediate output of the characters you type on your keyboard. If your users are going to interact with this application through the keyboard, you probably want to disable echo mode.
        Specified by:
        setEcho in class ANSITerminal
        Parameters:
        echoOn - true if keyboard input will immediately echo, false if it's hidden
